00044 /// A simple class which contains the basic specification for a QC
00045 /// analysis method. Typically populated from a row in the QCA file.
00046 class QCMethod {
00047 
00048     public:
00049         /// Enumeration of possible analysis types
00050         enum AnalysisType {
00051             DM,             ///< DM Call Rate
00052             GENDER,         ///< EM ChrX Het Rate Gender Call
00053             HOMHILO,        ///< Min Diff between Hom Peak and Valley
00054             ADJHOMHILO,     ///< Adjusted Hom Min Hi Low used for SNP6
00055             //
00056             MULTICHANNEL_DISHQC,
00057             MULTICHANNEL_HOMHILO,
00058             MULTICHANNEL_SIGNALBACKGROUND,
00059             MULTICHANNEL_VARIABILITY,
00060         };
00061 
00062         /// Virtual Destructor
00063         virtual ~QCMethod() { }
00064 
00065         std::string analysisName; ///< The name of the analysis
00066         std::string groupName; ///< The group of probesets to use
00067         AnalysisType analysis; ///< The analysis type
00068         std::map<std::string,std::string> options; ///< Analysis options
00069 
00070         ///@todo it would be nice to handle more sophisticated
00071         ///      options (ie not just doubles). Something
00072         ///      like ChipStream and QuantMethod analysis
00073         ///      string configurations
00074 
00075         /**
00076          * Create a CelListener for the encapsulated method
00077          * @param layout - ChipLayout info w/ QC probesets loaded
00078          * @param celFiles - vector of cel file names to process
00079          * @param psOpts - QCProbesetOptions instance with info on QC probesets
00080          * @return pointer to CelListener. caller needs to free.
00081          */
00082         CelListener *createCelListener(ChipLayout *layout,
00083                                        vector<string> &celFiles,
00084                                        QCProbesetOptions &psOpts);
00085 
00086         /**
00087          * Create a DmListener from an DM analysis method
00088          * @param layout - ChipLayout info w/ QC probesets loaded
00089          * @param probesetNames - vector of QC probesets to use
00090          * @param celFiles - vector of cel file names to process
00091          * @return pointer to DmListener. caller needs to free.
00092          */
00093         DmListener *createDmListener(ChipLayout *layout,
00094                                      const std::vector<QCProbesetOptions::nameLigationBase_t>& probesetNames,
00095                                      const std::vector<std::string>& celFiles);
00096 
00097         /**
00098          * Create a EmGenderCelListener from a GENDER analysis method
00099          * @param layout - ChipLayout info w/ QC probesets loaded
00100          * @param probesetNames - vector of QC probesets to use
00101          * @param celFiles - vector of cel file names to process
00102          * @return pointer to EmGenderCelListener. caller needs to free.
00103          */
00104         EmGenderCelListener *createEmGenderCelListener(
00105                                      ChipLayout *layout,
00106                                      const std::vector<QCProbesetOptions::nameLigationBase_t>& probesetNames,
00107                                      const std::vector<std::string>& celFiles);
00108 
00109         /**
00110          * Create a HomHiLoCelListener from a homhilo analysis method
00111          * @param layout - ChipLayout info w/ QC probesets loaded
00112          * @param probesetNames - vector of QC probesets to use
00113          * @param celFiles - vector of cel file names to process
00114          * @return pointer to HomHiLoCelListener. caller needs to free.
00115          */
00116         HomHiLoCelListener *createHomHiLoCelListener(
00117                                      ChipLayout *layout,
00118                                      const std::vector<QCProbesetOptions::nameLigationBase_t>& probesetNames,
00119                                      const std::vector<std::string>& celFiles);
00120 
00121   /**
00122    * Create a AdjHomHiLoCelListener from a adj-homhilo analysis method
00123    * @param layout - ChipLayout info w/ QC probesets loaded
00124    * @param psOpts - QCProbesetOptions
00125    * @param celFiles - vector of cel file names to process
00126    * @return pointer to AdjHomHiLoCelListener. caller needs to free.
00127    */
00128   AdjHomHiLoCelListener*
00129   createAdjHomHiLoCelListener(ChipLayout *layout,
00130                               QCProbesetOptions &psOpts,
00131                               std::vector<std::string> &celFiles);
00132 
00133   
00134   // MULTICHANNEL_DISHQC
00135   MultiChannelNonOverlapCelListener*
00136   createMultiChannelNonOverlapCelListener(ChipLayout *layout,
00137                                           const vector<QCProbesetOptions::nameLigationBase_t>& probesetNames,
00138                                           QCProbesetOptions &psOpts);
00139   // MULTICHANNEL_HOMHILO
00140   MultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener*
00141   createMultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener(ChipLayout* layout,
00142                                        const std::vector<QCProbesetOptions::nameLigationBase_t>& probesetNames,
00143                                        QCProbesetOptions& psOpts);
00144   // MULTICHANNEL_SIGNALBACKGROUND
00145   SignalBackgroundCelListener*
00146   createSignalBackgroundCelListener(ChipLayout *layout,
00147                                     const vector<QCProbesetOptions::nameLigationBase_t>& probesetNames,
00148                                     QCProbesetOptions &psOpts);
00149   // MULTICHANNEL_VARIABILITY
00150   VariabilityScoreCelListener*
00151   createVariabilityScoreCelListener(ChipLayout *layout,
00152                                     const vector<QCProbesetOptions::nameLigationBase_t>& probesetNames,
00153                                     QCProbesetOptions &psOpts);
00154 
00155   private:
00156   /**
00157    * Create a vector of probeLists
00158    */
00159   void fillProbeListVector(std::vector<ProbeListPacked>& probeSets,
00160                            const std::vector<QCProbesetOptions::nameLigationBase_t>& probesetNames,
00161                            ChipLayout* layout);
00162 
00163   void fillProbeListVector(std::vector<ProbeListPacked>& probeSets,
00164                            const std::vector<std::string>& probesetNames,
00165                            ChipLayout* layout);
00166 
00167 };
00168 
00169 /// A simple class to contain the multiple analysis specified
00170 /// in a QCA file.
00171 class QCAnalysisOptions {
00172     public:
00173         std::string defaultAnalysisName; ///< The default analysis name
00174         std::vector<QCMethod> methods; ///< Vector of analysis methods
00175 
00176         /**
00177          * Read in a QCA File and populate a QCAnalysisOptions instance
00178          * @param qcaFileName - the name of the qca file to load
00179          * @param opts - the QCAnalysisOptions instance to populate
00180          */
00181         static void readQCAFile(const std::string &qcaFileName,
00182                                 QCAnalysisOptions &opts);
00183 
00184         /// Virtual Destructor
00185         virtual ~QCAnalysisOptions() { }
00186 
00187         static float ToFloat(std::string valString);
00188 
00189     private:
00190         /**
00191          * Private utility method to split up the options string
00192          * @param str - the string to parse
00193          * @param val - the parsed out key=val pair to be filled in
00194          * @param sep1 - separator between key and val (default '=')
00195          * @param sep2 - separator between options (default ',')
00196          * @param return - bool indicating if there are more options
00197          */
00198         static bool SplitOptions(std::string& str,
00199                                  std::pair<std::string,std::string>& val,
00200                                  const char sep1='=',
00201                                  const char sep2=',');
00202 };
